text:
Hi everyone.
Recently I started to use HubSpot and its CLI then I found that I can't upload modules those are created by `hs create module`  command.
<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/issues/1224|This is issue> I explained that.
And I fixed this problem in <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cli/pull/1225|this PR>.

I feel that this command is very basic command you might often use so I am considering about I made misunderstanding about recognizing problem.
Does above command problem occur in your develop environment?
Welcome any comment. This is my first time to contribute OSS so I am very excited.
yea, you always have to change a couple of things on module.js before uploading it, kinda annoying

Thanks!
Now, PR haven't reviewed yet. If you have some tips for receiving reviews from code owners.
Hello, which type of field on a new prop will give me an actual true/false through the API? I'm always getting an string which is not ideal for my purpose. Currently, I'm using a single checkbox.

Hello everyone,

We have a potential client with their current website set up on WordPress. They’re interested in migrating only a few pages to HubSpot on the same domain, without using a subdomain. Could you advise if there’s a way to achieve this?

Yes, it is possible to host a few pages on HubSpot while keeping the main site on WordPress on the same domain, but it requires some specific configurations i.e: reverse proxy setup, URL redirects for landing pages, etc. :slightly_smiling_face:
got it, thanks <@U0623BNGR5H>

What are you trying to achieve from this actually <@U07RHD1GJEA>? Just need a case scenario or the `what and why` :slightly_smiling_face:

If you're looking to get a true Boolean `true or false` response through the API rather than a string, it's key to use the right field type and configuration i.e: use the single checkbox field but convert the string result `true or false` to a Boolean in your code.

Hi Everyone
Anyone documented the entire lead journey from the moment a form or chat is submitted on our site through each step in our system. Creating a workflow map and documentation that covers the whole process, I’ll need this in both a document format and a visual format to make sure everyone can easily see and understand the flow. Please help.
What form integrations have yall used into HubSpot? Im trying to do some research but would love the communities input!

Anything internally used within the tech stack that will streamline the process, that could either be private apps or other apps from the marketplace such as Aircall, Zapier, etc. 

As long as it doesn’t damage the integrity of the data within HS, that is super important.
Hey Mayank, are you looking for something simple or detailed i.e: process flow chart. I’ve setup something similar, can share it with you :slightly_smiling_face:
Our client is hesitant to invest more money to a higher tier plan, so im looking into 3rd party platforms to map the data into HubSpot
not sure if theres a fan-favorite out there... The goal is to handle conditional logic and potentially handle payments

Had the same case before, Zapier works best in this case scenario and sits as a hub between any other tools within the tech stack. You might want to consider a paid plan on Zapier though, you’ll hit a bit of limitations when it comes to scalability but by that time it’ll be a proven POC that the expansion to a higher HS tier is worth it for the ROI.
How customized can you get with mapping that data? If the client doesnt upgrade their plan, theyre still limited with how data is structured though right?
yeahh its just worth upgrading at that point lol
I'm yet to start and thinking how can I present process/step. Please share asap what you set up in past i believe it will help me.

Zapier has really progressed with that functionality even within the steps and the checks to be followed before placing it on a HS record to be honest. Noticed that change over the past year, was using Zapier paid business version and didn’t face any issues for complex customizations. Only thing you might want to test out with is the number of tasks that’ll take place.

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hello, I am looking to develop a public app for the HS marketplace. I would like to know if each request that HubSpot makes to my backend (for example from a custom CRM card) can include information about the client who is making the request, such as their portal ID, in order to determine from which account they are making the request.

<@U05S96AE2N8> I have used and can recommend typeform,  which gives you amazing forms and integrates with HS:

<https://www.typeform.com/try/HubSpot/>

Hello, I need urgent help. How could I add an e-signature into my HubSpot form .My client to add a signature feature bottom of the form but in HubSpot no option and after talk with support they suggest third party if I use third party like DocuSign how could I achieve this?

Aloha Habibur, you can achieve a form of consent and acknowledgment within HubSpot forms by using a *"Terms and Conditions" checkbox* at the bottom of the form. This doesn’t capture a drawn or typed signature but does serve as an acceptance of terms, which is legally acceptable in many cases.

Alternatively, you can also use a *HubSpot Quote*, which includes an “Accept” button, capturing the client’s consent and details. HubSpot Quotes provide a more formal approval option and can replace the need for tools like DocuSign in many scenarios.

Another option to do a twist to this which I've implemented before is to set up a workflow triggered upon form submission in HubSpot. Then send an email with a CTA *"Sign"* for the user to click.
